channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid PCR tests: Call to investigate cost of travel tests in Wales
item.description: David TC Davies wants people in Wales to be able to access cheaper, private tests like in England.

item.title: Child, 3, seriously hurt in Pontypridd dog attack
item.description: Police said a member of the public stepped in to help the child in the attack at a country park.

item.title: Welsh triathlete suffers 'life-threatening' injuries at event
item.description: Nathan Ford is in intensive care after suffering serious spinal and brain injuries injuries.

item.title: Pontneddfechan: Man drowned at waterfall after getting pulled under
item.description: Hermanta Rai was visiting the beauty spot with friends when he got into difficulties in the water.

item.title: Vale of Glamorgan councillor abused child for 10 years, trial hears
item.description: Former teacher Anthony Hampton denies abusing four children between the 1970s and 1990s.

item.title: Covid: Under 25s drive rise in positive cases
item.description: Under 25s account for more than half of cases as Wales' Covid rate rises to highest since January.

item.title: Tesco and Iceland bosses warn over Christmas supplies
item.description: But Tesco's chairman says don't "overdramatise" lorry driver crisis, as Iceland warns problem getting worse.

item.title: Aaron Ramsey: Wales braced for injury blow, but hope he can face Estonia
item.description: Wales hope Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey will be fit for their World Cup qualifier against Estonia in September.

item.title: UK City of Culture 2025: North Wales tourism boss saddened by rival bids
item.description: Entries from three nearby areas for the 2025 title "dilutes" them all, Jim Jones says.

item.title: Birds of prey: Chick and egg thefts fall to boost numbers
item.description: Birds of prey like the red kite have been brought back from the "brink of extinction" in Wales.

item.title: Covid rules saw traffic fall but more cycling in Wales
item.description: Last year there was a 68.4% increase in cycling on the roads compared with the previous year.

item.title: Snowdon: Llanberis residents kept awake by 24/7 tourists
item.description: Residents complain of early morning celebrations by visitors returning from night climbs.

item.title: Covid: Calls to investigate cost of travel tests in Wales
item.description: Tory MP David TC Davies says people in Wales should be able to shop around for a PCR test supplier.

item.title: Levelling up: Lessons from Rhyl on the changes needed
item.description: The BBC asks locals in the town of Rhyl how the government's levelling up agenda could help them.

item.title: Snowdon hectic with 24/7 tourists, say Llanberis residents
item.description: Residents say walkers have been trudging up and down to the peak around the clock.

item.title: Love Island: Liam Reardon's hometown raises a pint after win with partner Millie
item.description: "It's hard not to see them grow in popularity," one TV critic said of Liam and partner Millie.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Baroness Grey-Thompson tips Welsh duo for gold
item.description: Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson tips Aled Sion Davies and Hollie Arnold as Wales' best hopes for gold at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Porthcawl RNLI surfer rescue in storm captured on camera
item.description: The footage of the rescue shows an 18-year-old US surfer pulled clear of a rip current.

item.title: Kieffer Moore: Cardiff City would have to replace striker if he left, says Mick McCarthy
item.description: Manager Mick McCarthy says Cardiff City would need to replace Wales striker Kieffer Moore if he leaves this summer.

item.title: Matt Bush turns focus to Paris 2024 after injury rules him out of Tokyo Paralympics
item.description: World Para-taekwondo champion Matt Bush say it's "unfortunate" injury ruled him out of the Tokyo Paralympics but he is ready to "move on" and is already focused on Paris 2024.

item.title: Wales' World Cup qualifier with Belarus in Russia a 'nightmare', says Robert Page
item.description: Manager Robert Page says Wales face a "logistical nightmare" in playing their World Cup qualifier with Belarus in Russia.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Ieuan Evans backs touring side to continue
item.description: Former British and Irish Lions wing Ieuan Evans insists the touring side must continue in the congested international calendar.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 15th Paralympic gold as GB claim six medals
item.description: Britain's Sarah Storey wins her 15th Paralympic title for Britain's first gold medal at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Galw am ymchwilio i gost profion er mwyn teithio o Gymru
item.description: Mae Dirprwy Weinidog Swyddfa Cymru yn cyhuddo Llywodraeth Cymru o "wneud bywyd yn anodd" i deithwyr.

item.title: Diffyg triniaeth epilepsi yng ngorllewin Cymru
item.description: Yn ôl un elusen, mae pobl epileptig yn yr ardal angen aros hyd at 18 mis ar gyfer apwyntiad.

item.title: Triathletwr o Gymru wedi'i anafu'n ddifrifol
item.description: Mae Nathan Ford yn cael ei drin mewn adran gofal dwys yn yr Alban yn dilyn digwyddiad ym Mhencampwriaeth y Triathlon Prydeinig.

item.title: Comin Greenham: Y chwiorydd o Gymru heriodd Thatcher a Reagan
item.description: Nodi 40 mlynedd ers i fenywod o Gymru orymdeithio yn erbyn arfau niwclear

item.title: Cwpan yr EFL: Abertawe 4-1 Plymouth Argyle
item.description: Morgan Whittaker yn sgorio hat-tric wrth i'r Elyrch hedfan trwodd i drydedd rownd Cwpan yr EFL.
